title: Judge Keeps November Hearing Date to Finalize Puerto Rico’s Restructuring Plan
sub_head: Oversight board doubts it can agree to proposed amendments to failed legislation
body:
The judge overseeing Puerto Rico’s bankruptcy said confirmation hearings set for November on the territory’s debt restructuring plan will remain in place, even after the island’s Senate last week failed to pass a key piece of legislation needed to finalize the plan.
Judge Laura Taylor Swain at a virtual hearing Monday in the U.S. District Court in San Juan denied a request by the territory’s oversight board, which is steering Puerto Rico’s bankruptcy plan, to put off the confirmation hearing scheduled for Nov. 8.
